errors.label: Starting date cannot be greater than ending date
ICU beds cannot be greater than Hospital beds
errors.formula: this.model.numberOfBeds != undefined && this.model.icuNumberOfBeds != undefined && this.model.icuNumberOfBeds > this.model.numberOfBeds

variables.label: Identificative number
variables.name: IdentificativeNumber
variables.definition: Due to ethical reason the present register cannot record the patient's name and surname. Remember to register all the anagraphic data associated with this code.

variables.label: previous episodes of the same disease
variables.name: PreviousEpisodesOfTheSameDisease

variables.label: Clinical condition at presentation
variables.name: ClinicalConditionAtPresentation
variables.definition: Please indicate the clinical status according to the Sepsis-2 definition (https://www.sccm.org/Documents/SSC-Guidelines.pdf)

variables.label: Haemodynamic status at presentation
variables.name: HaemodynamicStatusAtPresentation
variables.definition: Hemodynamic instability is defined as persistent Systolic blood pressure <90mmHg after cristalloids infusion, Heart rate >120

values.label: Severe sepsis at the admission - score 3
values.name: SevereSepsis

values.label: Septic shock at the admission - score 5
values.definition: acute circulatory failure characterized by persistent arterial hypotension. It always requires vasopressor agents
values.name: SepticShock

values.label: Delayed initial intervention - score 3
values.definition: Preoperative duration of peritonitis (localized or diffuse) > 24 h)
values.name: DelayedInitialIntervention

values.label: Immunosuppression - score 3
values.name: Immunosuppression
values.definition: chronic glucocorticoids, immunosuppresant agents, chemotherapy, lymphatic diseases, virus

values.label: Uncomplicated: Diverticula, thickening of the wall, increased density of the pericolic fat
values.name: UncomplicatedDiverticulaThickeningOfTheWallIncreasedDensityOfThePericolicFat

values.label: Stage 1a Pericolic air bubbles or little pericolic fluid without abscess
values.name: StageAPericolicAirBubblesOrLittlePericolicFluidWithoutAbscess

values.label: Stage 2b: Distant air (>5cm from inflamed bowel segment)
values.name: StageBDistantAirCmFromInflamedBowelSegment

values.label: Stage 3: Diffuse fluid without distant free air (no hole in colon)
values.name: StageDiffuseFluidWithoutDistantFreeAirNoHoleInColon

values.label: Stage 4: Diffuse fluid with distant free air (persistent hole in colon)
values.name: StageDiffuseFluidWithDistantFreeAirPersistentHoleInColon

values.label: inflammatory changes in pancreas and peripancreatic fat (2)
values.name: InflammatoryChangesInPancreasAndPeripancreaticFat

values.label: two or more poorly defined fluid collections (4)
values.name: TwoOrMorePoorlyDefinedFluidCollections

variables.label: other Surgical procedure (at presentation)
variables.name: OtherSurgicalProcedureAtPresentation
variables.definition: Please indicate only the surgical procedure during the first 12-24 hours from arrival

pages.label: Open abdomen
pages.visible: (this.model.AcuteAppendicitis == 'Yes' || this.model.OpenAbdomenAcuteCholecystitis == 'Yes' || this.model.OpenAbdomenAcuteDiverticulitis == 'Yes' || this.model.OpenAbdomenPostOperativePostInterventiveComplications == 'Yes' || this.model.OpenAbdomenAcutePancreatitis == 'Yes' || this.model.OpenAbdomenPerforatedGastroDuodenalUlcers == 'Yes' || this.model.OpenAbdomenAsbo == 'Yes' || this.model.OpenAbdomenColonicNeoplasticEmergencies == 'Yes' || this.model.OpenAbdomenGynecologicalEmergencies == 'Yes' || this.model.OpenAbdomenVascularEmergencies == 'Yes' || this.model.OpenAbdomenIntestinalIschemia == 'Yes' || this.model.OpenAbdomenAbdominalWallHernia == 'Yes' || this.model.OpenAbdomenForeignBodies == 'Yes') && this.model.module == 'openabdomen'

variables.label: ACS (Abdominal Compartment Syndrom)
variables.name: AcsAbdominalCompartmentSyndrom
variables.definition: Abdominal Compartment syndrome is defined as a sustained IAP (intra-Abdominal-Pressure) greater than 20 mm Hg that is associated with the development of new organ dysfunction or failure

variables.label: Temporary abdominal closure technique
variables.name: TemporaryAbdominalClosureTechnique
variables.definition: In case of several techniques adopted choose the most relevant

variables.label: EAF
variables.name: Eaf
variables.definition: Please, indicate if the patient developed an Entero Atmospheric Fistula

variables.label: Treatment of EAF
variables.name: TreatmentOfEaf
variables.definition: Please, briefly describe the technique adopted for the treatment of the fistula

variables.label: Bjork classification at first intervention
variables.name: BjorkClassificationAtFirstIntervention
variables.definition: 1A Clean, no fixation 1B Contaminated, no fixation 1C Enteric leak, no fixation 2A Clean, developing fixation 2B Contaminated, developing fixation 2C Enteric leak, developing fixation3A Clean, frozen abdomen 3B Contaminated, frozen abdomen 4 Established enteroatmospheric fistula, frozen abdomen

variables.label: Bjork classification at closure
variables.name: BjorkClassificationAtClosure
variables.definition: 1A Clean, no fixation 1B Contaminated, no fixation 1C Enteric leak, no fixation 2A Clean, developing fixation 2B Contaminated, developing fixation 2C Enteric leak, developing fixation3A Clean, frozen abdomen 3B Contaminated, frozen abdomen 4 Established enteroatmospheric fistula, frozen abdomen

variables.label: type of infection
variables.name: TypeOfInfection
variables.definition: Consider an Infection as Hospital acquired if it develops after at least 48h of hospitalization

variables.label: grade (clavien-dindo)
variables.name: GradeClavienDindo
variables.definition:
Please classify according to the Clavien Dindo classification: 
Grade I: Any deviation from the normal postoperative course without the need for pharmacological treatment or surgical, endoscopic and radiological interventions. Allowed therapeutic regimens are: drugs as antiemetics, antipyretics, analgetics, diuretics and electrolytes and physiotherapy. This grade also includes wound infections opened at the bedside.
Grade II Requiring pharmacological treatment with drugs other than such allowed for grade I complications. Blood transfusionsand total parenteral nutritionare also included.
Grade III: Requiring surgical, endoscopic or radiological intervention
Grade IV: Life-threatening complication (including CNS complications)* requiring IC/ICU-management.
Greade V Death of a patient
